00016 SDL_GLContext createOpenGLContext( SDL_Window *window);

00018 int main()
00019 {
00020   srand(static_cast <unsigned> (time(0)));
00021 
00022 
00023   // Initialize SDL's Video subsystem
00024   if (SDL_Init(SDL_INIT_VIDEO) < 0 )
00025   {
00026     // Or die on error
00027     SDLErrorExit("Unable to initialize SDL");
00028   }
00029 
00030   // now get the size of the display and create a window we need to init the video
00031   SDL_Rect rect;
00032   SDL_GetDisplayBounds(0,&rect);
00033   // now create our window
00034   SDL_Window *window=SDL_CreateWindow("Colossal-Riot",
00035                                       SDL_WINDOWPOS_CENTERED,
00036                                       SDL_WINDOWPOS_CENTERED,
00037                                       1280,
00038                                       720,
00039                                       SDL_WINDOW_OPENGL | SDL_WINDOW_RESIZABLE
00040                                      );
00041   // check to see if that worked or exit
00042   if (!window)
00043   {
00044     SDLErrorExit("Unable to create window");
00045   }
00046   // Create our opengl context and attach it to our window
00047    SDL_GLContext glContext=createOpenGLContext(window);
00048    if(!glContext)
00049    {
00050      SDLErrorExit("Problem creating OpenGL context");
00051    }
00052    // make this our current GL context (we can have more than one window but in this case not)
00053    SDL_GL_MakeCurrent(window, glContext);
00054   /* This makes our buffer swap syncronized with the monitor's vertical refresh */
00055   SDL_GL_SetSwapInterval(1);
00056 
00057   // we need to initialise the NGL lib which will load all of the OpenGL functions, this must
00058   // be done once we have a valid GL context but before we call any GL commands. If we dont do
00059   // this everything will crash
00060   ngl::NGLInit::instance();
00061   // now clear the screen and swap whilst NGL inits (which may take time)
00062   glClear(GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT);
00063   SDL_GL_SwapWindow(window);
00064   // flag to indicate if we need to exit
00065   bool quit=false;
00066   // sdl event processing data structure
00067   SDL_Event event;
00068   // now we create an instance of our ngl class, this will init NGL and setup basic
00069   // opengl stuff ext. When this falls out of scope the dtor will be called and cleanup
00070   // our gl stuff
00071   NGLDraw ngldraw(rect.w, rect.h);
00072   // resize the ngl to set the screen size and camera stuff
00073   ngldraw.resize(rect.w,rect.h);
00074 
00075   Timer gameTimer;
00076   double timeElapsed = 0.0;
00077   double currentTime = 0.0;
00078 
00079 
00080 
00081 
00082 //-------MAIN LOOP----------------------------------------------------------------------
00083   while(!quit)
00084   {
00085     while ( SDL_PollEvent(&event) )
00086     {
00087       switch (event.type)
00088       {
00089         // this is the window x being clicked.
00090         case SDL_QUIT : quit = true; break;
00091 
00092         // process the mouse data by passing it to ngl class
00093 
00094         case SDL_MOUSEMOTION : ngldraw.mouseMoveEvent(event.motion);break;
00095         case SDL_MOUSEBUTTONDOWN : ngldraw.mousePressEvent(event.button);break;
00096         case SDL_MOUSEBUTTONUP : ngldraw.mouseReleaseEvent(event.button); break;
00097         case SDL_MOUSEWHEEL : ngldraw.wheelEvent(event.wheel); break;
00098 
00099         // if the window is re-sized pass it to the ngl class to change gl viewport
00100         // note this is slow as the context is re-create by SDL each time
00101         case SDL_WINDOWEVENT :
00102           int w,h;
00103           // get the new window size
00104           SDL_GetWindowSize(window,&w,&h);
00105 
00106           ngldraw.resize(w, h);
00107 
00108         break;
00109 
00110           // now we look for a keydown event
00111         case SDL_KEYDOWN:
00112         {
00113           if(ngldraw.getGameState() == gamePlay)
00114           {
00115               switch( event.key.keysym.sym )
00116               {
00117                 // if it's the escape key quit
00118                 case SDLK_ESCAPE :  quit = true; break;
00119                 case SDLK_w : glPolygonMode(GL_FRONT_AND_BACK,GL_LINE); break;
00120                 case SDLK_s : glPolygonMode(GL_FRONT_AND_BACK,GL_FILL); break;
00121                 case SDLK_f : SDL_SetWindowFullscreen(window,SDL_TRUE);
00122                                 glViewport(0,0,rect.w,rect.h);
00123                                 break;
00124                 case SDLK_g : SDL_SetWindowFullscreen(window,SDL_FALSE); break;
00125 
00126                 case SDLK_RETURN : ngldraw.setGameState(gameMenu); ngldraw.endGame(); break;
00127 
00128                 case SDLK_p : ngldraw.setGameState(gamePause); gameTimer.resetTimer(); break;
00129                 case SDLK_t : std::cout<<gameTimer.getCurrentTime()<<std::endl; break;
00130                 case SDLK_r : std::cout<<"reset"<<std::endl; gameTimer.resetTimer(); break;
00131                 default : break;
00132               }
00133           }
00134           else if(ngldraw.getGameState() == gameMenu)
00135           {
00136               switch( event.key.keysym.sym )
00137               {
00138                 // if it's the escape key quit
00139                 case SDLK_ESCAPE :  quit = true; break;
00140                 case SDLK_w : glPolygonMode(GL_FRONT_AND_BACK,GL_LINE); break;
00141                 case SDLK_s : glPolygonMode(GL_FRONT_AND_BACK,GL_FILL); break;
00142                 case SDLK_f : SDL_SetWindowFullscreen(window,SDL_TRUE);
00143                                 glViewport(0,0,rect.w,rect.h);
00144                                 break;
00145                 case SDLK_g : SDL_SetWindowFullscreen(window,SDL_FALSE); break;
00146 
00147                 case SDLK_RETURN : ngldraw.setGameState(gamePlay); ngldraw.startGame(4); break;
00148 
00149                 case SDLK_t : std::cout<<gameTimer.getCurrentTime()<<std::endl; break;
00150                 case SDLK_r : std::cout<<"reset"<<std::endl; gameTimer.resetTimer(); break;
00151 
00152                 default : break;
00153               }
00154            }
00155           else if (ngldraw.getGameState() == gamePause)
00156           {
00157             switch (event.key.keysym.sym)
00158             {
00159               case SDLK_ESCAPE : quit = true; break;
00160               case SDLK_p : ngldraw.setGameState(gamePlay); gameTimer.resetTimer(); break;
00161 
00162              default : break;
00163             }
00164           }
00165         } //end of key down
00166 
00167         default : break;
00168 
00169     } // end of event switch
00170 } // end of poll events
00171 
00172     if (ngldraw.getGameState() == gameQuit)
00173     {
00174       quit = true;
00175     }
00176     else if(ngldraw.getGameState() == gamePlay)
00177     {
00178       gameTimer.calculateTimeElapsed();
00179       timeElapsed = gameTimer.getTimeElapsed();
00180       currentTime=gameTimer.getCurrentTime();
00181 
00182       ngldraw.update(timeElapsed,currentTime);
00183     }
00184 
00185     // now we draw ngl
00186     ngldraw.draw();
00187 
00188 
00189 
00190 
00191     // swap the buffers
00192     SDL_GL_SwapWindow(window);
00193 
00194 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00195 
00196   }
00197   // now tidy up and exit SDL
00198  SDL_Quit();
00199 }
00200 
00201 
00202 SDL_GLContext createOpenGLContext(SDL_Window *window)
00203 {
00204   // Request an opengl 3.2 context first we setup our attributes, if you need any
00205   // more just add them here before the call to create the context
00206   // SDL doesn't have the ability to choose which profile at this time of writing,
00207   // but it should default to the core profile
00208   // for some reason we need this for mac but linux crashes on the latest nvidia drivers
00209   // under centos
00210   #ifdef DARWIN
00211     SDL_GL_SetAttribute(SDL_GL_CONTEXT_MAJOR_VERSION, 4);
00212     SDL_GL_SetAttribute(SDL_GL_CONTEXT_MINOR_VERSION, 1);
00213     SDL_GL_SetAttribute(SDL_GL_CONTEXT_PROFILE_MASK, SDL_GL_CONTEXT_PROFILE_CORE);
00214     SDL_GL_SetAttribute(SDL_GL_ACCELERATED_VISUAL, 1);
00215   #else
00216 
00217     SDL_GL_SetAttribute(SDL_GL_CONTEXT_MAJOR_VERSION, 3);
00218     SDL_GL_SetAttribute(SDL_GL_CONTEXT_MINOR_VERSION, 2);
00219     SDL_GL_SetAttribute(SDL_GL_CONTEXT_PROFILE_MASK, SDL_GL_CONTEXT_PROFILE_CORE);
00220     SDL_GL_SetAttribute(SDL_GL_ACCELERATED_VISUAL, 1);
00221   #endif
00222   // set multi sampling else we get really bad graphics that alias
00223   SDL_GL_SetAttribute(SDL_GL_MULTISAMPLEBUFFERS, 1);
00224   SDL_GL_SetAttribute(SDL_GL_MULTISAMPLESAMPLES,4);
00225   // Turn on double buffering with a 24bit Z buffer.
00226   // You may need to change this to 16 or 32 for your system
00227   // on mac up to 32 will work but under linux centos build only 16
00228   SDL_GL_SetAttribute(SDL_GL_DEPTH_SIZE, 16);
00229   // enable double buffering (should be on by default)
00230   SDL_GL_SetAttribute(SDL_GL_DOUBLEBUFFER, 1);
00231   //
00232   return SDL_GL_CreateContext(window);
00233 
00234 }
00235 
00236 void SDLErrorExit(const std::string &_msg)
00237 {
00238   std::cerr<<_msg<<"\n";
00239   std::cerr<<SDL_GetError()<<"\n";
00240   SDL_Quit();
00241   exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00242 }
